ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Question on getting into Dragon raids
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh, not quite that bad yet on Xegony. All three raids I ve been on thusfar were pick-up raids. Don t think Xegony has a master calendar at this point. Thanks
ygData.messageBody:
Heh, not quite that bad yet on Xegony. All three raids I've been on
thusfar were pick-up raids. Don't think Xegony has a master calendar at
this point. Thanks for advice though. I know the dragons do go down fast
after a patch.

Tzeetch "scale hunting" Bard

--- "Jamie R. Bedford" <bbedford@...> wrote:


I don't know about Xegony, but on Tunare generally the dragons die within
12 hours of the servers coming up.  That, and we use a reservation
type system (based on EzBoard) where leaders will sign up for entire weeks
such that they can lead given a patch day or a regular respawn and anyone
interested in joining the raid can contact them well ahead of time. 
Oh, the dragons are booked months ahead of time on Tunare, too, just as
something to possibly look forward to dependent on your server.<BR>
